Cloud.AWS.EC2.Instance.description: Request schema for provisioning of an AWS machine resource

account.description: Cloud Account indicates the name of the endpoint used to provision this machine.
account.title: Cloud Account

finalRelativeDN.description: The machine will be moved to this DN in the configured Active Directory after provisioning
finalRelativeDN.title: Final Relative DN

relativeDN.description: Relative DN of the configured Active Directory will be overridden when this property is set
relativeDN.title: Override configured Active Directory relative DN

securityGroup.description: The machine will be added to this security group in the configured Active Directory after provisioning
securityGroup.title: Security Group

address.description: Machine IP address, populated by discovery or provisioning.
address.title: Address

attachedDisks.description: List of disks to attach to the machine.

source.description: The self link of the disks to attach to the machine.
source.title: Source

attachedDisks.title: Attached Disks

anyOf.description: desiredCapacity value is mandatory when scale policy is Fixed
scheduledScaleRules value is mandatory when scale policy is Scheduled
metricScaleRules value is mandatory when scale policy is Metric

autoScaleConfiguration.description: Settings for an auto scaling group for this machine, which automatically increases or decreases resources based on policies.

desiredCapacity.description: The number, before scaling, of machine instances in the auto scaling group.
desiredCapacity.title: Desired capacity

maxSize.description: The maximum number of machines to allow in the auto scaling group.
maxSize.title: Maximum size

metricScaleRules.description: Settings that define the scaling action and when it should occur.

action.description: Settings for the scaling action itself.

cooldown.description: The minimum time, in seconds, between scaling actions.
cooldown.title: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes and before the next scaling activity can start.

type.description: The scaling action that occurs when triggered.
type.title: The type of action that should occur when the scale rule fires.

value.description: The amount by which to scale up or down. Positive values add, and negative values subtract.
value.title: The amount by which to scale, based on the specified adjustment type

action.title: The action of the scale operation

trigger.description: Settings for when a scaling action should occur.

evaluationPeriods.description: The number of periods over which to measure data. The total evaluation time cannot exceed one day, so this number multiplied by the period cannot exceed 86,400 seconds.
evaluationPeriods.title: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold

metric.description: The metric that is the catalyst for a scaling action.
metric.title: Тhe metric that defines what the rule monitors.

operator.description: The comparison operator that is used when evaluating the collected metric data against the threshold.
operator.title: The operator that is used to compare the metric data and the threshold.

period.description: The period, in seconds, at which the metric is evaluated. Valid values are 10, 30, and any multiple of 60.
period.title: The period, in seconds, over which the specified statistic is applied

statistic.description: How metrics from multiple instances are combined.
statistic.title: The metric statistic type

threshold.description: The threshold that, when reached, triggers the scaling action.
threshold.title: The threshold of the metric that triggers the scale action

trigger.title: The trigger of the scale operation

metricScaleRules.title: Rules of the METRIC policy

minSize.description: The minimum number of machines in the auto scaling group.
minSize.title: Minimum size

policy.description: Policy type of Fixed, Scheduled, or Metric.
policy.title: Policy

desiredCapacity.description: The number, before scaling, of machine instances in the auto scaling group.
desiredCapacity.title: Desired capacity

maxSize.description: The maximum size of the auto scaling group.
maxSize.title: Maximum size

minSize.description: The minimum size of the auto scaling group.
minSize.title: Minimum size

recurrence.description: The schedule for repeating the action, in UNIX cron syntax format.
recurrence.title: The recurring schedule for this action

autoScaleConfiguration.title: Auto Scale Configuration

awsVpcId.description: Amazon VPC to which the EC2 instance will be provisioned. This property is computed and not available for user input.
awsVpcId.title: VPC ID

cloudConfig.description:
When provisioning an instance, machine cloud-init startup instructions from user data fields.
Sample cloud config instructions: 
```
#cloud-config
repo_update: true
repo_upgrade: all
packages:
- httpd
- mariadb-server

runcmd:
- [ sh, -c, "amazon-linux-extras install -y lamp-mariadb10.2-php7.2 php7.2" ]
- systemctl start httpd
- sudo systemctl enable httpd
```
cloudConfig.title: Cloud Config

cloudConfigSettings.description: Specify how the provided Cloud Config should be handled

deploymentFailOnCloudConfigRuntimeError.description: In case cloud-config content processing throws an error the provisioning process should fail or continue
deploymentFailOnCloudConfigRuntimeError.title: Fail when processing cloud-config content produces an error

phoneHomeFailOnTimeout.description: In case a timeout occurs whether the provisioning process should fail or continue
phoneHomeFailOnTimeout.title: Fail when timeout occurs when waiting on phone_home callback

phoneHomeShouldWait.description: A phone_home module will be added to the Cloud Config and the provisioning will wait on a callback prior proceeding
phoneHomeShouldWait.title: Wait on phone_home module callback

phoneHomeTimeoutSeconds.description: The period of time to wait for the phone_home module callback to occur
phoneHomeTimeoutSeconds.title: Timeout for phone_home callback

cloudConfigSettings.title: Cloud Config Settings

Examples:

imageRef.title: AMI ID

machineType.title: Machine Type

name.title: Name

networks.description: Networks to attach to the machine. Multiple network interfaces are allowed.

address.description: For static IP, specifies the machine IP address. Blank for dynamic assignment.

assignPublicIpAddress.description: Whether or not the machine has a public Internet IP address.
assignPublicIpAddress.title: Assign Public IpAddress

assignment.description: IP address assignment of static or dynamic. Dynamic is the default.

deviceIndex.title: Device Index

network.description: The id of the attached network, usually bound to the actual network id during design.

osType.description: Operating system of the machine, populated by discovery or provisioning. Values include WINDOWS and LINUX.

powerState.description: Machine power state of ON, OFF, GUEST_OFF, UNKNOWN, or SUSPEND.

providerId.description: A unique identifier of the resource in the context of the provider.
providerId.title: Provider ID

region.description: Region name of the instance where machine landed.
region.title: Region name

remoteAccess.description: Settings to remotely connect to the provisioned machine, by public/private key pair or username/password authentication. AWS supports key pair but not username/password.

authentication.description:
One of three authentication types.
generatedPublicPrivatekey: The provisioned machine generates the public/private key pair and enables SSH to use them without user input.
publicPrivateKey: The user enters the private key in the SSH command. See remoteAccess.sshKey.
usernamePassword: The user enters a username and password for remote access.
authentication.title: Authentication

password.description: Remote access password. Not supported for the AWS.
password.title: Password

privateKey.description: In generated key pair authentication, the computed private key on the user's machine.
privateKey.title: Private key

sshKey.description:
In key pair authentication, the public key on the provisioned machine. Users are expected to log in with their private key and a default username from the cloud provider. An AWS Ubuntu image comes with default user ubuntu, and Azure comes with default user azureuser.To log in by SSH:
```
ssh -I <private-key> ubuntu@52.90.80.153
ssh -I <private-key> azureuser@40.76.14.255
```
sshKey.title: Public key

username.description: Remote access username. Not supported for the AWS.
username.title: Username

account.description: The name of the Ansible control machine as designated in the infrastructure integration.

authentication.description: Type of authentication used to connect to machine from Ansible.

count.description: The number of resource instances to be created.
count.title: Count

groups.description: The list of groups in the inventory file to which the compute resource should be added.

host.description: The machine to be managed by Ansible. Enter the name using the format '${<resource_name>.*}'.

hostName.description: Name of the host to be created in Ansible inventory. If this property is not specified, then host will be created using resource_name of machine.

hostVariables.description: Variables in YAML syntax that will be assigned to the host. They will be placed under inventory host_vars/*

inventoryFile.description: Absolute path to the Ansible inventory file

maxConnectionRetries.description: Number of times to retry in case of connection failures

osType.description: The node operating system. Valid options are Linux and Windows. The default is Linux.

password.description: The password for the supplied user to connect to the node via SSH for Linux or WinRM for Windows nodes. This field is required when using username/password authentication.

playbookRunUserPassword.description: Password of the playbookRunUsername user. When specified, playbooks are run with this user's password. By default, user password configured in account is used.

playbookRunUsername.description: User with which to run playbooks. When specified, playbooks are run using this user. By default, the user configured in account is used.

playbooks.description: Specifies an Ansible playbook to use with the specified integration. An Ansible playbook is a collection of YAML scripts that define configuration management actions to execute on specified machines.

de-provision.description: Absolute paths to playbooks that should be run during provisioning time. Optionally, You can also provide the playbook level variables using -e or --extra-vars option. The variables can be set as key=value pair(s) or YAML/JSON string, or a filename. If using filename, prepend with @ and the filename should be the absolute path only and exist on the ACM. Example: --extra-vars version=1.23.45 other_variable=foo OR --extra-vars '{"version":"1.23.45","other_variable":"foo"}'

provision.description: Absolute paths to playbooks that should be run during provisioning time. Optionally, You can also provide the playbook level variables using -e or --extra-vars option. The variables can be set as key=value pair(s) or YAML/JSON string, or a filename. If using filename, prepend with @ and the filename should be the absolute path only and exist on the ACM. Example: --extra-vars version=1.23.45 other_variable=foo OR --extra-vars '{"version":"1.23.45","other_variable":"foo"}'

privateKey.description: The private key to use with the supplied user to connect to the node via SSH for linux nodes.

privateKeyFile.description: Absolute path to the private key on the ansible control machine to use with the supplied user to connect to the node via SSH for linux nodes.

username.description: The name of the existing OS user who will connect to the node via SSH for Linux nodes and WinRM for Windows nodes.

oneOf.description: templates value is mandatory
jobTemplates value is mandatory

account.description: The name of the Ansible Tower machine as designated in the infrastructure integration.

count.description: The number of resource instances to be created.
count.title: Count

host.description: The machine to be managed by Ansible. Enter the name using the format '${<resource_name>.*}'.

hostName.description: Name of the host to be created in Ansible inventory. If this property is not specified, then host will be created using resource name of machine.

hostVariables.description: Variables in YAML or JSON syntax that will be assigned to the host. They will be placed under inventory host_vars/*

jobTemplates.description:
Warning! jobTemplates is deprecated and will be removed. 
Use templates to execute job templates and workflow templates. 
Specifies an Ansible job template(s) to use with the specified integration. An Ansible job template is a collection of YAML scripts that define configuration management actions to execute on specified machines.

de-provision.description: Job Template that should be run during de provisioning time

provision.description: Job Template that should be run during provisioning time

maxConnectionRetries.description: Number of times to retry in case of unreachable error while running the regular or workflow job templates.

maxJobRetries.description: Number of times to retry in case of template job failure.

templates.description: Ansible job templates or workflow job templates to run. For all templates, type is set to job if type is not specified explicitly

de-provision.description: Ansible job templates or workflow job templates to run during deprovisioning time.

extraVars.description: Extra variables are used to pass the values maintained in the survey or if we need to pass some value through variables on launch,only valid json strings are accepted

name.description: Job template or Workflow template name

type.description: Template type. job stands for job_template and workflow stands for workflow_template. Default value is job.

useDefaultLimit.description: Use the default limit specified on the job_template / workflow_template instead of overriding with current host.

bootDiagnostics.title: Boot Diagnostics

cloudConfig.description:
When provisioning an instance, machine cloud-init startup instructions from user data fields.
Sample cloud config instructions: 
```
#cloud-config
repo_update: true
repo_upgrade: all
packages:
- httpd
- mariadb-server

runcmd:
- [ sh, -c, "amazon-linux-extras install -y lamp-mariadb10.2-php7.2 php7.2" ]
- systemctl start httpd
- sudo systemctl enable httpd
```
cloudConfig.title: Cloud Config

cloudConfigSettings.description: Specify how the provided Cloud Config should be handled

deploymentFailOnCloudConfigRuntimeError.description: In case processing of cloud-config content throws an error the provisioning process should fail or continue
deploymentFailOnCloudConfigRuntimeError.title: Fail when processing of cloud-config content throws an error

phoneHomeFailOnTimeout.description: In case a timeout occurs whether the provisioning process should fail or continue
phoneHomeFailOnTimeout.title: Fail when timeout occurs when waiting on phone_home callback

phoneHomeShouldWait.description: A phone_home module will be added to the Cloud Config and the provisioning will wait on a callback prior proceeding
phoneHomeShouldWait.title: Wait on phone_home module callback

phoneHomeTimeoutSeconds.description: The period of time to wait for the phone_home module callback to occur
phoneHomeTimeoutSeconds.title: Timeout for phone_home callback

extensions.description: Azure VM extensions to be created and attached when provisioning this machine. There are three properties that uniquely identify the Azure Extension - "publisher", "type" and "typeHandlerVersion". For the list of available Azure extensions see: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/extensions/features-windows#common-vm-extensions-reference and https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/extensions/features-linux#common-vm-extension-reference.

autoUpgradeMinorVersion.description: Indicates whether the extension should use a newer minor version if one is available at deployment time. Once deployed, however, the extension will not upgrade minor versions unless redeployed, even with this property set to true.

One of three authentication types.
generatedPublicPrivatekey: The provisioned machine generates the public/private key pair and enables SSH to use them without user input.
publicPrivateKey: The user enters the private key in the SSH command. See remoteAccess.sshKey.
usernamePassword: The user enters a username and password for remote access.

sshKey.description:
In key pair authentication, the public key on the provisioned machine. Users are expected to log in with their private key and a default username from the cloud provider. An AWS Ubuntu image comes with default user ubuntu, and Azure comes with default user azureuser.To log in by SSH:
```
ssh -I <private-key> ubuntu@52.90.80.153
ssh -I <private-key> azureuser@40.76.14.255
```

diskEncryptionKey.description:
Encrypts the disk using a customer-managed encryption key.
Encryption keys do not protect access to metadata of the disk.
After you encrypt a disk with a customer-managed key, the diskEncryptionKey.kmsKeyName is set to a key version name once the disk is created. The disk is encrypted with this version of the key.

cloudConfig.description:
When provisioning an instance, machine cloud-init startup instructions from user data fields.
Sample cloud config instructions: 
```
#cloud-config
repo_update: true
repo_upgrade: all
packages:
- httpd
- mariadb-server

runcmd:
- [ sh, -c, "amazon-linux-extras install -y lamp-mariadb10.2-php7.2 php7.2" ]
- systemctl start httpd
- sudo systemctl enable httpd
```
cloudConfig.title: Cloud Config

cloudConfigSettings.description: Specify how the provided Cloud Config should be handled

deploymentFailOnCloudConfigRuntimeError.description: In case processing of cloud-config content throws an error the provisioning process should fail or continue
deploymentFailOnCloudConfigRuntimeError.title: Fail when processing of cloud-config content throws an error

phoneHomeFailOnTimeout.description: In case a timeout occurs whether the provisioning process should fail or continue
phoneHomeFailOnTimeout.title: Fail when timeout occurs when waiting on phone_home callback

phoneHomeShouldWait.description: A phone_home module will be added to the Cloud Config and the provisioning will wait on a callback prior proceeding
phoneHomeShouldWait.title: Wait on phone_home module callback

phoneHomeTimeoutSeconds.description: The period of time to wait for the phone_home module callback to occur
phoneHomeTimeoutSeconds.title: Timeout for phone_home callback

In key pair authentication, the public key on the provisioned machine. Users are expected to log in with their private key and a default username from the cloud provider. An AWS Ubuntu image comes with default user ubuntu, and Azure comes with default user azureuser.To log in by SSH:
```
ssh -I <private-key> ubuntu@52.90.80.153
ssh -I <private-key> azureuser@40.76.14.255
```

loggingLevel.description:
The load balancer logging level. The logging levels that you define for any load balancer component on the blueprint apply to all load balancers in the blueprint.The available logging level options are NONE, EMERGENCY, ALERT, CRITICAL, ERROR, WARNING, INFO, DEBUG or NOTICE. 


NONE logging level in YAML maps to: 


-NSX-V: "Logging Disabled": true and "Log Level": info 

-NSXT-T: "Error Log Level": INFO
loggingLevel.title: Logging Level

name.description: Load balancer machine name.
name.title: Name

network.description: The network to attach to the load balancer.
network.title: Network

providerId.description: A unique identifier of the resource in the context of the provider.
providerId.title: Provider ID

resourceName.description: The actual name of the load balancer machine determined after the allocation.
resourceName.title: Actual name of the load balancer machine.

routes.description: Settings for incoming requests to reach the load balancer, for requests to be routed to machines in the pool, and for checking the health of machines in the pool.

oneOf.description: 'algorithmParameters' is required for 'algorithm' URL, URI and HTTP_HEADER.
'algorithmParameters' is not allowed for 'algorithm' ROUND_ROBIN, LEAST_CONNECTION, IP_HASH, WEIGHTED_ROUND_ROBIN and WEIGHTED_LEAST_CONNECTION.
'algorithm' is not required when setting a route, and 'algorithmParameters' is not allowed when 'algorithm' is not set

algorithm.description: The algorithm load balancing method. ROUND_ROBIN, WEIGHTED_ROUND_ROBIN, LEAST_CONNECTION, WEIGHTED_LEAST_CONNECTION, IP_HASH, URI, URL or HTTP_HEADER.
algorithm.title: Algorithm

algorithmParameters.description:
The load balancer algorithm parameters in NSX format. Algorithm parameters are required for algorithms URL, and HTTP_HEADER. 
Examples:  
"uriLength=len" where "1<=len<256" 
"uriDepth=dep" where "1<=dep<10" 
"headerName=name" 
"urlParam=param"
algorithmParameters.title: Algorithm Parameters

healthCheckConfiguration.description: Settings for checking the health of machines in the pool. The load balancer only routes requests to healthy machines.

oneOf.description: 'port', 'requestBody', 'responseBody', 'httpMethod' are not allowed for 'ICMP' health check protocol.
'httpMethod' is not allowed for 'TCP', 'UDP' health check protocols.
'httpMethod' requires 'HTTP' or 'HTTPS' protocol. 'port' is required for 'HTTP', 'HTTPS' protocols.
'port', 'protocol', 'httpMethod', 'requestBody', 'responseBody', 'urlPath' are not allowed when 'passiveMonitor' is true.

healthyThreshold.description: The number of continuous successful checks before a load balanced machine is declared healthy.
healthyThreshold.title: Healthy Threshold

httpMethod.description: HTTP or HTTPS method to use to detect server status for the health check request. Methods are GET, POST, OPTIONS, HEAD, or PUT.
httpMethod.title: Http Method

intervalSeconds.description: Interval, in seconds, between checks of load balanced machines.
intervalSeconds.title: Interval in Seconds

passiveMonitor.description: Enable passive monitor mode. This setting only applies to NSX-T.
passiveMonitor.title: Passive Monitor

port.description: Port number on the checked URL to the load balanced machine, which the health check targets.
port.title: Port

protocol.description: Communication protocol for the health check signal.
protocol.title: Protocol

requestBody.description: Health check request body content. Used by HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, and UDP protocols.
requestBody.title: Request Body

responseBody.description: Health check expected response body content. If the received string matches this response body the server is considered healthy. Used by HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, and UDP protocols.
responseBody.title: Response Body

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which a health check times out and counts as a failure.
timeoutSeconds.title: Timeout in Seconds

unhealthyThreshold.description: The number of continuous failed checks before a load balanced machine is declared unhealthy.
unhealthyThreshold.title: Unhealthy Threshold

urlPath.description: URL to the load balanced machine, which the health check targets.
urlPath.title: Url Path

healthCheckConfiguration.title: Health Check Configuration

instancePort.description: The target port used between the load balancer and the machines in the pool.
instancePort.title: Instance Port

instanceProtocol.description: The communication protocol used between the load balancer and the machines in the pool. HTTP, HTTPS, or TCP.
instanceProtocol.title: Instance Protocol

persistenceConfig.description: Settings for persistently directing client load balancer requests to the same server.

oneOf.description: 'maxIdle' is required for persistence 'type' SOURCE_IP.

allOf.description: 'cookieName' and 'cookieMode are required for persistence 'type' COOKIE.

oneOf.description: 'maxIdle' is required and 'maxAge' is not allowed if 'cookieMode' is type INSERT and 'cookieSessionTime' is specified as type PERSISTENCE.
'maxAge' and 'maxIdle' are required if 'cookieMode' is type INSERT and 'cookieSessionTime' is specified as type SESSION.
'maxAge' and 'maxIdle' are not allowed if 'cookieMode' is type INSERT and 'cookieSessionTime' is not specified.
'cookieSessionTime', 'maxAge' and 'maxIdle' are not allowed if 'cookieMode' is type PREFIX.
''cookieSessionTime', 'maxAge' and 'maxIdle' are not allowed if 'cookieMode' is type REWRITE.
Persistence type NONE requires no other properties.

cookieGarble.description: Specifies whether to garble cookie content for security purposes.
cookieGarble.title: Cookie Garble

cookieMode.description:
Specifies the cookie handling mode. Allowed values are INSERT, PREFIX and REWRITE. 

INSERT - the load balancer inserts a cookie in the HTTP response from server to client. 

PREFIX - the server controls the cookie and the load balancer only edits the value of the cookie. The server's cookie value is prepended with the server IP and port in the HTTP response from server to client. 

REWRITE - the server controls the cookie and the load balancer only edits the value of the cookie. The server's entire cookie value is replaced with the server IP and port in the HTTP response from server to client.
cookieMode.title: Cookie Mode

cookieName.description: For persistence type COOKIE, specifies the name of the cookie to use for session identification.
cookieName.title: Cookie Name

cookieSessionTime.description:
Specifies the type of cookie session timeout. Allowed values are PERSISTENCE or SESSION. 

PERSISTENCE - the cookie remains valid across client/browser sessions. 

SESSION - the cookie remains valid while the client/browser session remains open. 

Timeout lengths for both types are specified with maxAge in seconds and maxIdle in seconds.
cookieSessionTime.title: Cookie Session Time

ipPurge.description: For persistence type SOURCE_IP, specifies whether the load balancer removes old entries from the session table when full.
ipPurge.title: IP Purge

maxAge.description: Specifies the maximum cookie age (in seconds) between the first time the cookie occurs in a request and when the session is considered expired. Required by persistence type COOKIE with 'cookieSessionTime' type SESSION and 'cookieMode' type INSERT.
maxAge.title: Maximum Age

maxIdle.description:
Specifies the maximum idle time (in seconds) after which the session is expired. Required for persistence type SOURCE_IP and persistence type COOKIE when 'cookieSessionTime' is PERSISTENCE and cookieMode INSERT. 

For persistence type COOKIE with 'cookieSessionTime' type SESSION and 'cookieMode' type INSERT, the timeout period starts at the last time a request is made. For persistence type SOURCE_IP, timeout starts when all connections are closed.
maxIdle.title: Maximum Idle

type.description:
The type of session persistence to apply. Allowed values are NONE, COOKIE or SOURCE_IP. 

NONE - no load balancer persistence configuration is applied. 

COOKIE - the value of a session cookie is used to identify a session. 

SOURCE_IP - the client source IP address is used to identify a session.
type.title: Type

execution_arn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to be used when invoking the AWS Lambda function. For example: arn:aws:execute-api:us-west-1:654321:k47905, which can be concatenated with allowed stage, method, and resource path.
execution_arn.title: Execution Arn

minimum_compression_size.description: The REST API compresses responses of this size or greater. Range is integer from -1 to 10485760 (10 MB), where greater than -1 enables compression, Default is -1 (compression disabled).

compression_format.title: Compression Format

data_format_conversion_configuration.description: Settings for the serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from JSON to Parquet or ORC before writing it to S3.

enabled.description: Whether to convert. Default is false.
enabled.title: Enabled

input_format_configuration.description: (Required) Settings for the deserializer that converts the data from JSON.

deserializer.description: (Required) Which deserializer to use: Apache Hive JSON SerDe or OpenX JSON SerDe.

hive_json_ser_de.description: Settings for Apache Hive JSON SerDe.

timestamp_formats.description: How to parse date and time stamps found in the JSON input. See www.joda.org/joda-time/apidocs/org/joda/time/format/DateTimeFormat.html for the pattern. If omitted, Kinesis Data Firehose uses: java.sql.Timestamp::valueOfYou can also use special value millis to parse time stamps in epoch milliseconds.
timestamp_formats.title: Timestamp Formats

hive_json_ser_de.title: Hive Json Ser De

case_insensitive.description: Whether Kinesis Data Firehose converts JSON keys to lowercase before deserializing. Default is true.
case_insensitive.title: Case Insensitive

column_to_json_key_mappings.description: A map of column names to JSON keys, for keys that are not identical to a column name. Use this property when JSON contains keys that are Hive keywords, such as timestamp.For example, if you had a JSON key named timestamp, the property  ts = "timestamp" maps the key to a column named ts.
column_to_json_key_mappings.title: Column To Json Key Mappings

convert_dots_in_json_keys_to_underscores.description: Whether to replace dots in keys with underscores.  Apache Hive does not allow dots in column names. Default is false.For example, a JSON key of a.b would need its corresponding column name to be a_b.
convert_dots_in_json_keys_to_underscores.title: Convert Dots In Json Keys To Underscores

deserializer.title: Deserializer

input_format_configuration.title: Input Format Configuration

output_format_configuration.description: (Required) Settings for the serializer that converts the data to Parquet or ORC.

serializer.description: (Required) Which serializer to use: ORC SerDe or Parquet SerDe.

block_size_bytes.description: HDFS block size in MiB, used when calculating padding. Minimum is 64. Default is 256.Use this property if you expect to copy the data from S3 to HDFS before querying.
block_size_bytes.title: Block Size Bytes

bloom_filter_columns.description: List of column names for which Kinesis Data Firehose creates Bloom filters.
bloom_filter_columns.title: Bloom Filter Columns

bloom_filter_false_positive_probability.description: Bloom filter false positive probability (FPP) percentage. Range is 0 to 1. Default is 0.05.Smaller FPP results in a larger Bloom filter.
bloom_filter_false_positive_probability.title: Bloom Filter False Positive Probability

compression.description: Compression code for the serializer to use over data blocks. Default is SNAPPY.
compression.title: Compression

dictionary_key_threshold.description: Fraction of the total number of non-null rows. To turn off dictionary encoding, set the value to less than the number of distinct keys in the dictionary. To always use dictionary encoding, set the value to 1.
dictionary_key_threshold.title: Dictionary Key Threshold

enable_padding.description: Whether the serializer adds stripes padded to the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block boundaries. Default is false.Use this property if you expect to copy the data from S3 to HDFS before querying.
enable_padding.title: Enable Padding

format_version.description: File format version of V0_11 or V0_12. Default is V0_12.
format_version.title: Format Version

padding_tolerance.description: Tolerance for block padding as a percentage of stripe size. Range is between 0 and 1. Default is 0.05, meaning 5 percent of stripe size. Not used when enable_padding is false.For the default of 64 MiB ORC stripes and 256 MiB HDFS blocks, the default 5 percent reserves a maximum of 3.2 MiB for padding within the 256 MiB block. If the available size within the block were more than 3.2 MiB, a new, smaller stripe would be inserted to fit within that space. This ensures that no stripe crosses block boundaries and causes remote reads within a node-local task.
padding_tolerance.title: Padding Tolerance

row_index_stride.description: Number of rows between index entries. Minimum is 1,000. Default is 10,000.
row_index_stride.title: Row Index Stride

stripe_size_bytes.description: Number of bytes per stripe. Minimum is 8 MiB. Default is 64 MiB.
stripe_size_bytes.title: Stripe Size Bytes

block_size_bytes.description: HDFS block size in MiB, used when calculating padding. Minimum is 64. Default is 256.Use this property if you expect to copy the data from S3 to HDFS before querying.
block_size_bytes.title: Block Size Bytes

compression.description: Compression code for the serializer to use over data blocks. Default is SNAPPY.
compression.title: Compression

max_padding_bytes.description: Maximum amount of padding to apply.Default is 0.Use this property if you expect to copy the data from S3 to HDFS before querying.
max_padding_bytes.title: Max Padding Bytes

page_size_bytes.description: Parquet page size in KiB. Minimum is 64. Default is 1,024.Column chunks are divided into pages, an indivisible unit in terms of compression and encoding.
page_size_bytes.title: Page Size Bytes

writer_version.description: Row format version of V1 or V2. Default is V1.
writer_version.title: Writer Version

 - Amazon DynamoDB Streams - ARN of the stream.
 - Amazon Simple Queue Service - ARN of the queue.

Base 64 encoded SHA 256 hash of the deployment package specified in filename or S3. Used to trigger updates. 
Usually set by `${base64sha256(file("file.zip"))}` where file.zip is the local filename of the function source archive.

cloudConfig.description:
When provisioning an instance, machine cloud-init startup instructions from user data fields. 
Sample cloud config instructions: 
```
#cloud-config
repo_update: true
repo_upgrade: all
packages:
- httpd
- mariadb-server

runcmd:
- [ sh, -c, "amazon-linux-extras install -y lamp-mariadb10.2-php7.2 php7.2" ]
- systemctl start httpd
- sudo systemctl enable httpd
``` 
 When cloud-init is used with static network assignment a customization spec is created on the fly and applied to the machine. When using both we suggest disabling network configuration on your template to avoid errors.
cloudConfig.title: Cloud Config

cloudConfigSettings.description: Specify how the provided Cloud Config should be handled

deploymentFailOnCloudConfigRuntimeError.description: In case processing of cloud-config content throws an error the provisioning process should fail or continue
deploymentFailOnCloudConfigRuntimeError.title: Fail when processing of cloud-config content throws an error

phoneHomeFailOnTimeout.description: In case a timeout occurs whether the provisioning process should fail or continue
phoneHomeFailOnTimeout.title: Fail when timeout occurs when waiting on phone_home callback

phoneHomeShouldWait.description: A phone_home module will be added to the Cloud Config and the provisioning will wait on a callback prior proceeding
phoneHomeShouldWait.title: Wait on phone_home module callback

phoneHomeTimeoutSeconds.description: The period of time to wait for the phone_home module callback to occur
phoneHomeTimeoutSeconds.title: Timeout for phone_home callback

customizationSpec.description: If machine settings from a vSphere customization spec need to be applied upon creation, the name of the customization spec to use, which must exist on the endpoint. Example customizations include host, network, and licensing settings.

flavor.description: Generic types of compute resources, mapped in an environment to specific types of compute resources.
flavor.title: Flavor

folderName.description: The path to the folder where the virtual machine is provisioned, relative to the datacenter that the resource pool is in.
folderName.title: VM folder for provisioning

ignoreActiveDirectory.description: Indicates that the machine is not added to Active Directory by a policy. It skips the Active Directory policy.
ignoreActiveDirectory.title: Ignore Active Directory Integration

image.description: Generic compute images, mapped in an environment to specific compute resource images.
image.title: Image

imageRef.description: vSphere image used for creating the machine. Examples include templates, OVA or OVF links, snapshots, and content libraries.
imageRef.title: Custom Image Value

name.description: Name of the machine as specified in the blueprint.
name.title: Name

networks.description: Networks to attach to the machine. Multiple network interfaces are allowed.

address.description: For static IP, specifies the machine IP address. A comma separated list can be provided for dual stack or when more than one IPv6 address needs to be allocated. Blank for dynamic assignment.
address.title: Address

assignIPv6Address.description: Whether or not the machine will get an IPv6 address. This is relevant only when address field is not used.
assignIPv6Address.title: Assign Ipv6Address

assignPublicIpAddress.description: Whether or not the machine has a public Internet IP address.
assignPublicIpAddress.title: Assign Public IpAddress

assignment.description: IP address assignment of static or dynamic. Dynamic is the default. Do not use a static IP assignment when obtaining IP addresses from external IPAM systems using either a network configure event or a vRO ABX extensibility action.
assignment.title: Assignment

deviceIndex.description: The index of the Network Interface Card (NIC) attached to the machine. It is a 0-based index, i.e., the first NIC will have the deviceIndex = 0.
deviceIndex.title: Device Index

gateway.description: Network IPv4 gateways on a network interface. Each gateway address should be separated by comma
gateway.title: IPv4 gateways

netmask.description: Netmask for machine TCP/IP configuration. This is a computed custom property that can be used by another component for property binding.
netmask.title: Netmask

network.description: The id of the attached network, usually bound to the actual network id during design.
network.title: Network

primaryAddress.description: Sets the address of this nic as the primary IP address of the VM. This can only be specified for a single network interface.
primaryAddress.title: Primary IP address

securityGroups.description:
The ids of security groups attached to the machine Network Interface Card (NIC) during provisioning.

-'${resource.security_group_A.id}'
-'${resource.security_group_B.id}'

authentication.description:
One of three authentication types.
generatedPublicPrivatekey: The provisioned machine generates the public/private key pair and enables SSH to use them without user input.
publicPrivateKey: The user enters the private key in the SSH command. See remoteAccess.sshKey.
usernamePassword: The user enters a username and password for remote access.

password.description: Remote access password for the machine. Not supported for vSphere.

privateKey.description: In generated key pair authentication, the computed private key on the user's machine.

sshKey.description:
In key pair authentication, the public key on the provisioned machine. Users are expected to log in with their private key and a default username from the cloud provider. An AWS Ubuntu image comes with default user ubuntu, and Azure comes with default user azureuser.To log in by SSH:
```
ssh -I <private-key> ubuntu@52.90.80.153
ssh -I <private-key> azureuser@40.76.14.255
```
sshKey.title: Public key

username.description: Remote access username for the machine. Not supported for vSphere.
username.title: Username

imageRef value is mandatory

account.title: Cloud Account

finalRelativeDN.description: The machine will be moved to this DN in the configured Active Directory after provisioning
finalRelativeDN.title: Final Relative DN

relativeDN.description: Relative DN of the configured Active Directory will be overridden when this property is set
relativeDN.title: Override configured Active Directory relative DN

securityGroup.description: The machine will be added to this security group in the configured Active Directory after provisioning
securityGroup.title: Security Group

address.description: Machine IP address, populated by discovery or provisioning.
address.title: Address

attachedDisks.description: List of disks to attach to the machine.

source.description: The self link of the disks to attach the machine.
source.title: Source

attachedDisks.title: Attached Disks

anyOf.description: desiredCapacity value is mandatory when scale policy is Fixed
scheduledScaleRules value is mandatory when scale policy is Scheduled
metricScaleRules value is mandatory when scale policy is Metric

autoScaleConfiguration.description: Settings for an auto scaling group for this machine, which automatically increases or decreases resources based on policies.

desiredCapacity.description: The number, before scaling, of machine instances in the auto scaling group.
desiredCapacity.title: Desired capacity

maxSize.description: The maximum number of machines to allow in the auto scaling group.
maxSize.title: Maximum size

metricScaleRules.description: Settings that define the scaling action and when it should occur.

action.description: Settings for the scaling action itself.

cooldown.description: The minimum time, in seconds, between scaling actions.
cooldown.title: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes and before the next scaling activity can start.

type.description: The scaling action that occurs when triggered.
type.title: The type of action that should occur when the scale rule fires.

value.description: The amount by which to scale up or down. Positive values add, and negative values subtract.
value.title: The amount by which to scale, based on the specified adjustment type

action.title: The action of the scale operation

trigger.description: Settings for when a scaling action should occur.

evaluationPeriods.description: The number of periods over which to measure data. The total evaluation time cannot exceed one day, so this number multiplied by the period cannot exceed 86,400 seconds.
evaluationPeriods.title: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold

metric.description: The metric that is the catalyst for a scaling action.
metric.title: Тhe metric that defines what the rule monitors.

operator.description: The comparison operator that is used when evaluating the collected metric data against the threshold.
operator.title: The operator that is used to compare the metric data and the threshold.

period.description: The period, in seconds, at which the metric is evaluated. Valid values are 10, 30, and any multiple of 60.
period.title: The period, in seconds, over which the specified statistic is applied

statistic.description: How metrics from multiple instances are combined.
statistic.title: The metric statistic type

threshold.description: The threshold that, when reached, triggers the scaling action.
threshold.title: The threshold of the metric that triggers the scale action

trigger.title: The trigger of the scale operation

metricScaleRules.title: Rules of the METRIC policy

minSize.description: The minimum number of machines in the auto scaling group.
minSize.title: Minimum size

policy.description: Policy type of Fixed, Scheduled, or Metric.
policy.title: Policy

desiredCapacity.description: The number, before scaling, of machine instances in the auto scaling group.
desiredCapacity.title: Desired capacity

maxSize.description: The maximum size of the auto scaling group.
maxSize.title: Maximum size

minSize.description: The minimum size of the auto scaling group.
minSize.title: Minimum size

recurrence.description: The schedule for repeating the action, in UNIX cron syntax format.
recurrence.title: The recurring schedule for this action

autoScaleConfiguration.title: Auto Scale Configuration

cloudConfig.description:
When provisioning an instance, machine cloud-init startup instructions from user data fields.
Sample cloud config instructions: 
```
#cloud-config
repo_update: true
repo_upgrade: all
packages:
- httpd
- mariadb-server

runcmd:
- [ sh, -c, "amazon-linux-extras install -y lamp-mariadb10.2-php7.2 php7.2" ]
- systemctl start httpd
- sudo systemctl enable httpd
```
cloudConfig.title: Cloud Config

cloudConfigSettings.description: Specify how the provided Cloud Config should be handled

deploymentFailOnCloudConfigRuntimeError.description: In case processing of cloud-config content throws an error the provisioning process should fail or continue
deploymentFailOnCloudConfigRuntimeError.title: Fail when processing of cloud-config content throws an error

phoneHomeFailOnTimeout.description: In case a timeout occurs whether the provisioning process should fail or continue
phoneHomeFailOnTimeout.title: Fail when timeout occurs when waiting on phone_home callback

phoneHomeShouldWait.description: A phone_home module will be added to the Cloud Config and the provisioning will wait on a callback prior proceeding
phoneHomeShouldWait.title: Wait on phone_home module callback

phoneHomeTimeoutSeconds.description: The period of time to wait for the phone_home module callback to occur
phoneHomeTimeoutSeconds.title: Timeout for phone_home callback

Constraints are not allowed for 'new' security groups.

To allocate the correct security group, blueprint constraints are matched against infrastructure capability tags set by the administrator on security groups. Constraints must include the key name. Options include value, negative [!], and hard or soft requirement.

tag.description:
Constraint definition in syntax format: `[!]tag_key[:tag_value][:hard|:soft]` 
Examples:
```
!location:eu:hard
 location:us:soft
!optical
```

resourceName.description: The actual name of the security group determined after the allocation.
resourceName.title: Actual name of the security group.

anyOf.description: 'protocol' and 'ports' cannot be specified when 'service' is provided.
'service' cannot be specified when 'protocol' and 'ports' are provided.

oneOf.description: 'destination' is not allowed for 'inbound' firewall rules. This security group is the 'destination' for 'inbound' firewall rules.
'source' is not allowed for 'outbound' firewall rules. This security group is the 'source' for 'outbound' firewall rules.

access.description:
access: Allow – Allow the network traffic specified in this firewall rule. Default.
access: Deny – Block the network traffic specified in this firewall rule.
access: Drop - Reject the network traffic specified in this firewall rule.
access.title: Access

destination.description: Destination for outbound rules: Options are ANY, IP Address, IP set, CIDR, or reference to another security group.
destination.title: Destination

direction.description: Type of firewall rule direction: 'inbound' or 'outbound'.
direction.title: Direction

name.description: Rule name.
name.title: Name

ports.description: Comma separated list of ports and port ranges to be used for communication. Must also enter a 'protocol' value. Do not use if entering a 'service' value.
ports.title: Ports

protocol.description: Communication protocol. Values include ANY, TCP, UDP, ICMP, or ICMPv6. Must also enter 'ports' for outbound rules. Do not use if entering a 'service' value.
protocol.title: Protocol

service.description: Communication service. Values include SSH, RDP, HTTP, etc. Enter ANY for all traffic. Do not use if entering 'protocol' and 'ports'.
service.title: Service

source.description: Source for inbound rules: Options are ANY, IP Address, IP set, CIDR, or reference to another security group.
source.title: Source

tags.description: Applies to securityGroupType 'new'. Enter resources categories by using case-sensitive key names or key-value pair syntax.

Examples:
```
!location:eu:hard
 location:us:soft
!pci
```

The block device mapping, which defines the EBS volumes and instance store volumes to attach to
the instance at launch. For more information, see Block device mappings in the Amazon EC2 User
Guide. Defaults to None.

delete_on_termination.description:
Indicates whether the EBS volume is deleted on instance termination. For more information, see
Preserving Amazon EBS volumes on instance termination in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
delete_on_termination.title: delete_on_termination

capacity_reservation_preference.description: Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences.
capacity_reservation_preference.title: capacity_reservation_preference

client_token.description: The idempotency token for the instance.
client_token.title: client_token

count.description: The number of resource instances to be created.
count.title: Count

cpu_core_count.description: The number of CPU cores for the instance.
cpu_core_count.title: cpu_core_count

cpu_credits.description: The credit option for CPU usage of a T2, T3, or T3a instance. Valid values are standard and unlimited.
cpu_credits.title: cpu_credits

cpu_threads_per_core.description:
The number of threads per CPU core. To disable multithreading for the instance, specify a value of1 .
Otherwise, specify the default value of 2.
cpu_threads_per_core.title: cpu_threads_per_core

disable_api_termination.description: Indicates that an instance cannot be terminated using the Amazon Ec2 console, command line tool, or API.
disable_api_termination.title: disable_api_termination

ebs_optimized.description: Indicates whether the instance is optimized ofr Amazon EBS I/O.
ebs_optimized.title: ebs_optimized

elastic_gpu_specifications.description:
An elastic GPU to associate with the instance. An Elastic GPU is a GPU resource that you can
attach to your Windows instance to accelerate the graphics performance of your applications. For
more information, see Amazon EC2 Elastic GPUs in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Defaults to None.

* Type (str): The type of Elastic Graphics accelerator. For more information about the values to specify for
    Type, see Elastic Graphics Basics, specifically the Elastic Graphics accelerator column, in the
    Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide for Windows Instances.
elastic_gpu_specifications.title: elastic_gpu_specifications

elastic_inference_accelerators.description:
An elastic inference accelerator to associate with the instance. Elastic inference accelerators
are a resource you can attach to your Amazon EC2 instances to accelerate your Deep Learning (DL)
inference workloads. You cannot specify accelerators from different generations in the same
request. Defaults to None.

Count.description: The number of elastic inference accelerators to attach to the instance.  Default: 1
Count.title: Count

Type.description:
The type of elastic inference accelerator. The possible values are eia1.medium, eia1.large,
eia1.xlarge, eia2.medium, eia2.large, and eia2.xlarge.
Type.title: Type

elastic_inference_accelerators.title: elastic_inference_accelerators

enable_resource_name_dns_a_record.description: Indicates whether to respond to DNS queries for instance hostnames with DNS A records.
enable_resource_name_dns_a_record.title: enable_resource_name_dns_a_record

enable_resource_name_dns_aaaa_record.description: Indicates whether to respond to DNS queries for instance hostnames with DNS A records.
enable_resource_name_dns_aaaa_record.title: enable_resource_name_dns_aaaa_record

group_name.description: The affinity setting for the instance on the Dedicated Host.
group_name.title: group_name

hibernation_enabled.description: Indicates whether the instance is configured for hibernation.
hibernation_enabled.title: hibernation_enabled

host_id.description: The ID of the Dedicated Host on which the instance resides.
host_id.title: host_id

host_resource_group_arn.description: The ARN of the host resource group in which to launch the instances.
host_resource_group_arn.title: host_resource_group_arn

hostname_type.description:
The type of hostname for EC2 instances.
For IPv4 only subnets, an instance DNS name must be based on the instance IPv4 address.
For IPv6 only subnets, an instance DNS name must be based on the instance ID.
For dual-stack subnets, you can specify whether DNS names use the instance IPv4 address or the instance ID.
hostname_type.title: hostname_type

http_endpoint_enabled.description:
Enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on your instances. If you specify a value of
disabled, you cannot access your instance metadata. Default: enabled.
http_endpoint_enabled.title: http_endpoint_enabled

http_protocol_ipv6_enabled.description: Enables or disables the IPv6 endpoint for the instance metadata service.
http_protocol_ipv6_enabled.title: http_protocol_ipv6_enabled

http_put_response_hop_limit.description:
The desired HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests. The larger the number,
the further instance metadata requests can travel. Default: 1 Possible values: Integers from 1
to 64.
http_put_response_hop_limit.title: http_put_response_hop_limit

http_tokens.description:
The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests. If the state is optional, you can
choose to retrieve instance metadata with or without a signed token header on your request. If
you retrieve the IAM role credentials without a token, the version 1.0 role credentials are
returned. If you retrieve the IAM role credentials using a valid signed token, the version 2.0
role credentials are returned. If the state is required, you must send a signed token header
with any instance metadata retrieval requests. In this state, retrieving the IAM role
credentials always returns the version 2.0 credentials; the version 1.0 credentials are not
available. Default: Optional.
http_tokens.title: http_tokens

instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior.description:
Indicates whether an instance stops or terminates when you initiate
shutdown from the instance (using the operating system command for system shutdown).
instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior.title: instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior

instance_interruption_behavior.description: The behavior when a Spot Instance is interrupted. The default is terminate.
instance_interruption_behavior.title: instance_interruption_behavior

instance_requirements.description:
The attributes for the instance type. When you specify instance attributes, Amazon EC2 will identify
instance types with these attributes.
instance_requirements.title: instance_requirements

instance_state.description:
The reported state of the instance, possible values are:
pending, running, shutting-down, terminated, stopping, stopped
instance_state.title: instance_state

instance_type.description: The instance type to use for this instance on creation.
instance_type.title: instance_type

kernel_id.description: The kernel associated with this instance, if applicable.
kernel_id.title: kernel_id

market_type.description: The market (purchasing) option for the instance.
market_type.title: market_type

max_price.description: The maximum hourly price you're willing to pay for the Spot Instances.
max_price.title: max_price

metadata_tags_enabled.description:
Set to enabled to allow access to instance tags from the instance metadata. Set to disabled to
turn off access to instance tags from the instance metadata. For more information, see Work with
instance tags using the instance metadata. Default: disabled.
metadata_tags_enabled.title: metadata_tags_enabled

monitoring_enabled.description: Indicates whether detailed monitoring is enabled.
monitoring_enabled.title: monitoring_enabled

name.description: An Idem name of the resource.
name.title: name

network_interfaces.description:
The network interfaces to associate with the instance. This manages the network interface attachment
to the instance, network interfaces themselves are managed in a separate state. Defaults to None.

device_index.description:
The position of the network interface in the attachment order. A primary network interface has a
device index of 0. If you specify a network interface when launching an instance, you must
specify the device index.
device_index.title: device_index

network_card_index.description:
The index of the network card. Some instance types support multiple network cards. The primary
network interface must be assigned to network card index 0. The default is network card index 0.
If you are using RequestSpotInstances to create Spot Instances, omit this parameter because you
can’t specify the network card index when using this API. To specify the network card index, use
RunInstances.
network_card_index.title: network_card_index

network_interface_id.description:
The ID of the network interface. If you are creating a Spot Fleet, omit this parameter because
you can’t specify a network interface ID in a launch specification.
network_interface_id.title: network_interface_id

private_ip_address.description: The IPv4 address of the network interface within the subnet.
private_ip_address.title: private_ip_address

public_ip_address.description: The public IP address or Elastic IP address bound to the network interface.
public_ip_address.title: public_ip_address

network_interfaces.title: network_interfaces

nitro_enclave_enabled.description: Indicates whether the instance is enabled for AWS Nitro Enclaves.
nitro_enclave_enabled.title: nitro_enclave_enabled

owner_id.description: The ID of the AWS account that owns the reservation.
owner_id.title: owner_id

partition_number.description: The number of the partition that the instance is in.
partition_number.title: partition_number

private_ip_address.description: The Ipv4 address of the network interface within the subnet.
private_ip_address.title: private_ip_address

public_ip_address.description:
The public IPv4 address, or the Carrier IP address assigned to the instance, if applicable.
A Carrier IP address only applies to an instance launched in a subnet associated with a Wavelength Zone.
public_ip_address.title: public_ip_address

ram_disk_id.description: The ID of the RAM disk, if applicable.
ram_disk_id.title: ram_disk_id

region.description: vRA cloud account region to use during provisioning
region.title: region

resource_id.description: AWS Ec2 Instance ID.
resource_id.title: resource_id

root_device_name.description: The device name of the root device (for example, /dev/sda1).
root_device_name.title: root_device_name

running.description: Indicates whether the instance should be in the "running" state.
running.title: running

security_group_ids.description:
The IDs of the security groups. If you specify a network interface, you must specify any security
groups as part of the network interface. Default: Amazon EC2 uses the default security group.
security_group_ids.title: security_group_ids

source_dest_check.description: Indicates whether source/destination checking is enabled.
source_dest_check.title: source_dest_check

spot_instance_type.description:
The Spot Instance request type. Persistent Spot Instance requests are only supported when the instance
interruption behavior is either hibernate or stop.
spot_instance_type.title: spot_instance_type

sriov_net_support.description: Specifies whether enhanced networking with the Intel 82599 Virtual Function interface is enabled.
sriov_net_support.title: sriov_net_support

subnet_id.description: The ID of the subnet in which the instance is running.
subnet_id.title: subnet_id

tags.description: The tags to apply to the resource. Defaults to None.
tags.title: tags

tenancy.description: The tenancy of the instance (if the instance is running in a VPC). An instance with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware.
tenancy.title: tenancy

user_data.description: The user data for the instance.
user_data.title: user_data

valid_until.description: The end date of the request, in UTC format (YYYY -MM -DD T*HH* :MM :SS Z). Supported only for persistent requests.
valid_until.title: valid_until

account.description: The name of the vRA cloud account to use during provisioning
account.title: account

assign_ipv6_address_on_creation.description:
Specify true to indicate that network interfaces created in the specified subnet should be assigned an IPv6 address.
This includes a network interface that's created when launching an instance into the subnet (the instance therefore receives an IPv6 address).
assign_ipv6_address_on_creation.title: assign_ipv6_address_on_creation

availability_zone.description:
The Availability Zone or Local Zone for the subnet. Default: Amazon Web Services selects one for
you. If you create more than one subnet in your VPC, we do not necessarily select a different
zone for each subnet. To create a subnet in a Local Zone, set this value to the Local Zone ID,
for example us-west-2-lax-1a. For information about the Regions that support Local Zones, see
Available Regions in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide. To create a subnet in an
Outpost, set this value to the Availability Zone for the Outpost and specify the Outpost ARN. Defaults to None.
availability_zone.title: availability_zone

availability_zone_id.description: The AZ ID or the Local Zone ID of the subnet. Defaults to None.
availability_zone_id.title: availability_zone_id

cidr_block.description:
The IPv4 network range for the subnet, in CIDR notation. For example, 10.0.0.0/24. We modify the
specified CIDR block to its canonical form; for example, if you specify 100.68.0.18/18, we
modify it to 100.68.0.0/18.
cidr_block.title: cidr_block

count.description: The number of resource instances to be created.
count.title: Count

customer_owned_ipv4_pool.description: The customer-owned IPv4 address pool associated with the subnet. You must set this value when you specify true for MapCustomerOwnedIpOnLaunch .
customer_owned_ipv4_pool.title: customer_owned_ipv4_pool

disable_lni_at_device_index.description: Specify true to indicate that local network interfaces at the current position should be disabled.
disable_lni_at_device_index.title: disable_lni_at_device_index

enable_dns_64.description: Indicates whether DNS queries made to the Amazon-provided DNS Resolver in this subnet should return synthetic IPv6 addresses for IPv4-only destinations.
enable_dns_64.title: enable_dns_64

enable_lni_at_device_index.description: Indicates the device position for local network interfaces in this subnet.
enable_lni_at_device_index.title: enable_lni_at_device_index

ipv6_cidr_block.description: The IPv6 network range for the subnet, in CIDR notation. The subnet size must use a /64 prefix length. Defaults to None.
ipv6_cidr_block.title: ipv6_cidr_block

map_customer_owned_ip_on_launch.description: Specify true to indicate that network interfaces attached to instances created in the specified subnet should be assigned a customer-owned IPv4 address.
map_customer_owned_ip_on_launch.title: map_customer_owned_ip_on_launch

map_public_ip_on_launch.description: Indicates whether instances launched in this subnet receive a public IPv4 address.
map_public_ip_on_launch.title: map_public_ip_on_launch

name.description: An Idem name of the resource.
name.title: name

outpost_arn.description:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost. If you specify an Outpost ARN, you must also
specify the Availability Zone of the Outpost subnet. Defaults to None.
outpost_arn.title: outpost_arn

private_dns_name_options_on_launch.description:
The type of hostname for EC2 instances. For IPv4 only subnets, an instance DNS name must be based on the instance IPv4 address.
    For IPv6 only subnets, an instance DNS name must be based on the instance ID. For dual-stack subnets, you can specify whether DNS names use the instance IPv4 address or the instance ID.
* EnableResourceNameDnsARecord (bool):
    Indicates whether to respond to DNS queries for instance hostnames with DNS A records.
* EnableResourceNameDnsAAAARecord (bool):
    Indicates whether to respond to DNS queries for instance hostname with DNS AAAA records.
private_dns_name_options_on_launch.title: private_dns_name_options_on_launch

region.description: vRA cloud account region to use during provisioning
region.title: region

resource_id.description: AWS Subnet ID.
resource_id.title: resource_id

tags.description:
Dict in the format of {tag-key: tag-value} or List of tags in the format of
[{"Key": tag-key, "Value": tag-value}] to associate with the subnet.
Each tag consists of a key name and an associated value. Defaults to None.

* Key (str):
    The key name that can be used to look up or retrieve the associated value. For example,
    Department or Cost Center are common choices.

* Value (str):
    The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256
    Unicode characters.
tags.title: tags

account.description: The name of the vRA cloud account to use during provisioning
account.title: account

availability_zone.description: The Availability Zone in which to create the volume.
availability_zone.title: availability_zone

count.description: The number of resource instances to be created.
count.title: Count

encrypted.description:
Indicates whether the volume should be encrypted. The effect of setting the encryption state to
true depends on the volume origin (new or from a snapshot), starting encryption state,
ownership, and whether encryption by default is enabled. For more information, see Encryption by
default in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide. Encrypted Amazon EBS volumes must be
attached to instances that support Amazon EBS encryption. For more information, see Supported
instance types. Defaults to None.
encrypted.title: encrypted

iops.description:
The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS). For gp3, io1, and io2 volumes, this represents
the number of IOPS that are provisioned for the volume. For gp2 volumes, this represents the
baseline performance of the volume and the rate at which the volume accumulates I/O credits for
bursting. The following are the supported values for each volume type:    gp3: 3,000-16,000 IOPS
io1: 100-64,000 IOPS    io2: 100-64,000 IOPS    io1 and io2 volumes support up to 64,000 IOPS
only on Instances built on the Nitro System. Other instance families support performance up to
32,000 IOPS. This parameter is required for io1 and io2 volumes. The default for gp3 volumes is
3,000 IOPS. This parameter is not supported for gp2, st1, sc1, or standard volumes. Defaults to None.
iops.title: iops

kms_key_id.description:
The identifier of the Key Management Service (KMS) KMS key to use for Amazon EBS encryption. If
this parameter is not specified, your KMS key for Amazon EBS is used. If KmsKeyId is specified,
the encrypted state must be true. You can specify the KMS key using any of the following:   Key
ID. For example, 1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.   Key alias. For example,
alias/ExampleAlias.   Key ARN. For example, arn:aws:kms:us-
east-1:012345678910:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.   Alias ARN. For example,
arn:aws:kms:us-east-1:012345678910:alias/ExampleAlias.   Amazon Web Services authenticates the
KMS key asynchronously. Therefore, if you specify an ID, alias, or ARN that is not valid, the
action can appear to complete, but eventually fails. Defaults to None.
kms_key_id.title: kms_key_id

multi_attach_enabled.description:
Indicates whether to enable Amazon EBS Multi-Attach. If you enable Multi-Attach, you can attach
the volume to up to 16 Instances built on the Nitro System in the same Availability Zone. This
parameter is supported with io1 and io2 volumes only. For more information, see  Amazon EBS
Multi-Attach in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide. Defaults to None.
multi_attach_enabled.title: multi_attach_enabled

name.description: An Idem name of the volume resource.
name.title: name

outpost_arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost. Defaults to None.
outpost_arn.title: outpost_arn

region.description: vRA cloud account region to use during provisioning
region.title: region

resource_id.description: The AWS volume_id of the Volume. Defaults to None.
resource_id.title: resource_id

size.description:
The size of the volume, in GiBs. You must specify either a snapshot ID or a volume size. If you
specify a snapshot, the default is the snapshot size. You can specify a volume size that is
equal to or larger than the snapshot size. The following are the supported volumes sizes for
each volume type:    gp2 and gp3: 1-16,384    io1 and io2: 4-16,384    st1 and sc1: 125-16,384
standard: 1-1,024. Defaults to None.
size.title: size

snapshot_id.description:
The snapshot from which to create the volume. You must specify either a snapshot ID or a volume
size. Defaults to None.
snapshot_id.title: snapshot_id

tags.description:
dict in the format of ``{tag-key: tag-value}``. Defaults to None.

* Key (str):
    The key of the tag. Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws: .

* Value (str):
    The value of the tag. Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 255 Unicode characters.
tags.title: tags

throughput.description:
The throughput to provision for a volume, with a maximum of 1,000 MiB/s. This parameter is valid
only for gp3 volumes. Valid Range: Minimum value of 125. Maximum value of 1000. Defaults to None.
throughput.title: throughput

volume_type.description:
]
The volume type. This parameter can be one of the following values:   General Purpose SSD: gp2 |
gp3    Provisioned IOPS SSD: io1 | io2    Throughput Optimized HDD: st1    Cold HDD: sc1
Magnetic: standard    For more information, see Amazon EBS volume types in the Amazon Elastic
Compute Cloud User Guide. Default: gp2. Defaults to None.
volume_type.title: volume_type

account.description: The name of the vRA cloud account to use during provisioning
account.title: account

acl.description: The associated acl for this bucket ('private', 'public-read', 'public-read-write', 'authenticated-read').
acl.title: acl

count.description: The number of resource instances to be created.
count.title: Count

create_bucket_configuration.description:
The configuration information for the bucket. Defaults to None.
LocationConstraint (str, Optional): Specifies the Region where the bucket will be created.
If you don't specify a Region, the bucket is created in the US East (N. Virginia) Region (us-east-1).
create_bucket_configuration.title: create_bucket_configuration

grant_full_control.description: Allows grantee the read, write, read ACP, and write ACP permissions on the bucket.
grant_full_control.title: grant_full_control

grant_read.description: Allows grantee to list the objects in the bucket.
grant_read.title: grant_read

grant_read_acp.description: Allows grantee to read the bucket ACL.
grant_read_acp.title: grant_read_acp

grant_write.description:
Allows grantee to create new objects in the bucket.
For the bucket and object owners of existing objects, also allows deletions and overwrites of those objects.
grant_write.title: grant_write

grant_write_acp.description: Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable bucket.
grant_write_acp.title: grant_write_acp

name.description: An Idem name of the resource.
name.title: name

object_lock_configuration.description: The Object Lock configuration that you want to apply to the specified bucket.

ObjectLockEnabled.description:
Indicates whether this bucket has an Object Lock configuration enabled. Enable ObjectLockEnabled
when you apply ObjectLockConfiguration to a bucket.
ObjectLockEnabled.title: ObjectLockEnabled

Rule.description:
Specifies the Object Lock rule for the specified object. Enable this rule when you apply
ObjectLockConfiguration to a bucket. Bucket settings require both a mode and a period. The period can
be either Days or Years but you must select one. You cannot specify Days and Years at the same time.

DefaultRetention.description:
The default Object Lock retention mode and period that you want to apply to new objects placed
in the specified bucket. Bucket settings require both a mode and a period. The period can be either
Days or Years but you must select one. You cannot specify Days and Years at the same time.

Days.description:
The number of days that you want to specify for the default retention period. Must be used with
Mode.
Days.title: Days

Mode.description:
The default Object Lock retention mode you want to apply to new objects placed in the specified
bucket. Must be used with either Days or Years.
Mode.title: Mode

Years.description:
The number of years that you want to specify for the default retention period. Must be used with
Mode.
Years.title: Years

DefaultRetention.title: DefaultRetention

Rule.title: Rule

object_lock_configuration.title: object_lock_configuration

object_lock_enabled_for_bucket.description: Specifies whether you want S3 Object Lock to be enabled for the new bucket.
object_lock_enabled_for_bucket.title: object_lock_enabled_for_bucket

object_ownership.description:
The container element for object ownership for a bucket's ownership controls.

* BucketOwnerPreferred
    Objects uploaded to the bucket change ownership to the bucket owner if
    the objects are uploaded with the bucket-owner-full-control canned ACL.
* ObjectWriter
    The uploading account will own the object if the object is uploaded
    with the bucket-owner-full-control canned ACL.
* BucketOwnerEnforced
    Access control lists (ACLs) are disabled and no longer affect permissions.
    The bucket owner automatically owns and has full control over every object
    in the bucket. The bucket only accepts PUT requests that don't specify an
    ACL or bucket owner full control ACLs, such as the bucket-owner-full-control
    canned ACL or an equivalent form of this ACL expressed in the XML format.
object_ownership.title: object_ownership

region.description: vRA cloud account region to use during provisioning
region.title: region

resource_id.description: AWS S3 Bucket id
resource_id.title: resource_id

tags.description:
dict in the format of ``{tag-key: tag-value}`` or List of tags in the format of
``[{"Key": tag-key, "Value": tag-value}]`` to associate with the AMI.

* Key (str):
    The key name that can be used to look up or retrieve the associated value. For example,
    Department or Cost Center are common choices.

* Value (str):
    The value associated with this tag. For example, tags with a key name of Department could have
    values such as Human Resources, Accounting, and Support. Tags with a key name of Cost Center
    might have values that consist of the number associated with the different cost centers in your
    company. Typically, many resources have tags with the same key name but with different values.
    Amazon Web Services always interprets the tag Value as a single string. If you need to store an
    array, you can store comma-separated values in the string. However, you must interpret the value
    in your code.
tags.title: tags

account.description: The name of the vRA cloud account to use during provisioning
account.title: account

bursting_enabled.description: Set to true to enable bursting beyond the provisioned performance target of the disk. Bursting is disabled by default. Does not apply to Ultra disks.
bursting_enabled.title: bursting_enabled

count.description: The number of resource instances to be created.
count.title: Count

creation_data.description: Disk source information. CreationData information cannot be changed after the disk has been created.

create_option.description:
Enumerates the possible sources of a disk's creation.
Enum type. Allowed values:
    - "Attach" - Disk will be attached to a VM.
    - "Copy" - Create a new disk or snapshot by copying from a disk or snapshot specified by the given sourceResourceId.
    - "CopyStart" - Create a new disk by using a deep copy process, where the resource creation is considered complete only after all data has been copied from the source.
    - "Empty" - Create an empty data disk of a size given by disk_size_gb.
    - "FromImage" - Create a new disk from a platform image specified by the given imageReference or galleryImageReference.
    - "Import" - Create a disk by importing from a blob specified by a sourceUri in a storage account specified by storageAccountId.
    - "ImportSecure" - Similar to Import create option. Create a new Trusted Launch VM or Confidential VM supported disk by importing additional blob for VM guest state specified by securityDataUri in storage account specified by storageAccountId.
    - "Restore" - Create a new disk by copying from a backup recovery point.
    - "Upload" - Create a new disk by obtaining a write token and using it to directly upload the contents of the disk.
    - "UploadPreparedSecure" - Similar to Upload create option. Create a new Trusted Launch VM or Confidential VM supported disk and upload using write token in both disk and VM guest state
create_option.title: create_option

create_mode.description:
Specifies the mode of database creation.
"Default": regular database creation.
"Copy": creates a database as a copy of an existing database. sourceDatabaseId must be specified as the resource ID of the source database.
"Secondary": creates a database as a secondary replica of an existing database. sourceDatabaseId must be specified as the resource ID of the existing primary database.
"PointInTimeRestore": Creates a database by restoring a point in time backup of an existing database. sourceDatabaseId must be specified as the resource ID of the existing database, and restorePointInTime must be specified.
"Recovery": Creates a database by restoring a geo-replicated backup. sourceDatabaseId must be specified as the recoverable database resource ID to restore.
"Restore": Creates a database by restoring a backup of a deleted database. sourceDatabaseId must be specified. If sourceDatabaseId is the database's original resource ID, then sourceDatabaseDeletionDate must be specified. Otherwise sourceDatabaseId must be the restorable dropped database resource ID and sourceDatabaseDeletionDate is ignored. restorePointInTime may also be specified to restore from an earlier point in time.
"RestoreLongTermRetentionBackup": Creates a database by restoring from a long term retention vault. recoveryServicesRecoveryPointResourceId must be specified as the recovery point resource ID.

Copy, Secondary, and RestoreLongTermRetentionBackup are not supported for DataWarehouse edition.
create_mode.title: create_mode

source_resource_id.description:
The resource identifier of the source associated with the create operation of this database.
This property is only supported for DataWarehouse edition and allows to restore across subscriptions.
When sourceResourceId is specified, sourceDatabaseId, recoverableDatabaseId, restorableDroppedDatabaseId and sourceDatabaseDeletionDate must not be specified and CreateMode must be PointInTimeRestore, Restore or Recover.
When createMode is PointInTimeRestore, sourceResourceId must be the resource ID of the existing database or existing sql pool, and restorePointInTime must be specified.
When createMode is Restore, sourceResourceId must be the resource ID of restorable dropped database or restorable dropped sql pool.
When createMode is Recover, sourceResourceId must be the resource ID of recoverable database or recoverable sql pool.
When source subscription belongs to a different tenant than target subscription, "x-ms-authorization-auxiliary" header must contain authentication token for the source tenant. For more details about "x-ms-authorization-auxiliary" header see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/management/authenticate-multi-tenant
source_resource_id.title: source_resource_id
